text: Roman Grigoryevich Viktyuk (, ; October 28, 1936 – November 17, 2020) was a Ukrainian-Russian theatre director, actor, and playwright. He was born in Lviv, Ukraine. His career began in 1956. In 2006, he was honored with the People's Artist of Ukraine and in 2009 with the People's Artist of Russia. He was also Professor of the Russian Academy of Theatre Arts (GITIS).Biography In late-October 2020, Viktyuk was hospitalized in Moscow with COVID-19. He died from the infection and thrombosis on November 17 2020 at the age of 84.Режисер Роман Віктюк помер після зараження коронавірусом, Ukrayinska Pravda (16 November 2020) Kinopoisk.ru ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1936 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Moscow Category:Deaths from thrombosis Category:Russian theatre directors Category:Russian stage actors Category:Russian writers Category:Ukrainian actors Category:Ukrainian writers Category:Russian playwrights
title: Roman Viktyuk
